p: After decisions are made about climate change and health responses, ensuring that effective policies to control environmental determinants of health are enacted and maintained will be critical to providing effective services. Using the surveillance networks described above, health systems must work closely with agencies that monitor food, water, air quality, and waste. When monitoring data indicate dangerous conditions, health authorities should take proactive programmatic and policy steps to reduce harmful discharges and exposure to particular contaminants. As likelihoods of disease outbreaks or property damage vary due to changes in climatic conditions, regulations should be updated to reflect current understandings of risks [ 45].
